title: First "About Me" Page
shortDescription: My first site, created from scratch, just so happens to be about myself!
fullDescription: This site marks my initial venture into creating a website from scratch, also serving as my first attempt at a personal "About Me" page. While it doesn't heavily rely on JavaScript, it does showcase a good deal of CSS. Take a moment to compare it with the site you're currently exploring, built with React and Tailwind. I feel it demonstrates some noteworthy progress in my web development journey.

title: Second "About Me" Page
shortDescription: Just look around, you are already visiting this new page!
fullDescription: Guess what? I managed to assemble my homepage using React and Tailwind. Take a look around and feel free to compare it with my first one. If you're curious to delve into the code, be my guest!

title: Film Finder
shortDescription: REST API Project. Find yourself a movie for the evening.
fullDescription: This project showcases the power of a REST API to present you with a randomly selected movie from your chosen genre on TMDB (The Movie Database). Through a simple click on the like or dislike button, you can create a list of movies you want to catch and those you'd rather skip. Initially started as a CodeCademy project with foundational code, but I took it up a notch, making the site responsive and fully functional. The technologies employed include JavaScript and CSS, providing a seamless and engaging user experience.

title: Credit Card Validator
shortDescription: Check if a fake number matches the credit card algorithm.
fullDescription: This kicked off as a Codecademy project where you could test whether a solo number or a bunch of them are correct (NEVER EVER give anyone your actual credit card number!). I opted for focusing on individual numbers - if they are ok you get the logo of the company that supposedly handed out the card, if not my code provides a valid alternative.

title: Jamming - music app
shortDescription: Powered by Spotify's API. Search for your favourite artist and add songs to the playlist.
fullDescription: Once you're on Spotify, my app makes it easy to find your favourite tunes and put together playlists to spice up your account. Built with React, it's user-friendly, responsive, and smoothly handles REST API tasks.

title: CSS Battle
shortDescription: How I have fun with CSS challenges.
fullDescription: Have you ever tried CSS Battle? It's a blast! You can challenge yourself by creating shapes and become a CSS maestro. I personally enjoy this shape-forming game as a delightful and amusing way to kickstart a coding day. Check out a few of these shapes on my site for a sneak peek!    If you want to view it on your mobile device be sure your srceen is at least 400px wide.

title: Reddit Viewer
shortDescription: View Reddit with my redux app.
fullDescription: This project is a Reddit viewer application built in Vite, using React and Redux Toolkit. It allows users to browse Reddit content, search for specific terms, filter data based on predefined categories, and view detailed information about selected subreddits including the comment section.

title: GitHub
shortDescription: Feel free to check if I'm up to anything.
fullDescription: Feel free to see what I'm up to. While I might not update this site regularly, you can potentially find something new and exciting on my GitHub.
